analysisEngineMetaData.name: Lexical Sophistication Feature: Brown (FW Type)
analysisEngineMetaData.description:
Calculates lexical sophistication of the text. Three sophistication measures are calculated from each norm list: AW: all words LW: lexical words, which are verbs, nouns, adverbs and adjectives FW: function words, which are non-lexical words A norm list is a list where a norm value that describes a certain aspect of a word is given to each word. Only words that are included in the norm list are calculated. Words that do not appear in the norm list are omitted.
Token features take into consideration all word tokens, while type features calculate only unique tokens.
This feature calculates lexical sophistication with the Brown norm list of frequencies by Brown (1984), which is included in the MRC Psycholinguistic Database (http://websites.psychology.uwa.edu.au/school/MRCDatabase/mrc2.html).
AAE dependency: SentenceAnnotator.xml TokenAnnotator.xml POSAnnotator.xml

configurationParameter.name: scope
configurationParameter.description: options: AW: all words LW: lexical words FW: function words, i.e. non-lexical words

configurationParameter.name: type
configurationParameter.description: whether to calculate word types instead of tokens

externalResourceDependency.description: a look up table is the frequency list (or other word-value mapping lists) with which word sophistication values are obtained.

externalResource.name: Brown
externalResource.description: Brown Frequency list from MRC Psycholinguisitc Database.
